cab.content: THIS DOCUMENT IS THE PROPERTY OF HIS BRITANNIC MAJESTY'S GOVERNMENT IPrinted for the War Cabinet. April 1941.SECRET. Copy No. 44W.M. (41)34th Conclusions.TO BE KEPT UNDER LOCK AND KEY.It is requested that special care may be taken toensure the secrecy of this document.WAR CABINET 34 (41).CONCLUSIONS of a Meeting of the War Cabinet held at 10 Downing Street,S.W. 1, on Wednesday, April 2, 1941, at 5-30 p.m.Present:The Right Hon. "Winston S. Churchill, M.P., Prime Minister (in the Chair).The Right Hon. C. R. Attlee, M.P.,Lord Privy Seal.The Right Hon. A. Greenwood, M.P.,Minister without Portfolio.The Right Hon. Sir Kingsley Wood,M.P., Chancellor of the Exchequer.The Right Hon. Sir John Anderson,M.P., Lord President of the Council.The Right Hon. Lord Beaverbrook,Minister of Aircraft Production.The Right Hon. Ernest Bevin, M.P.,Minister of Labour and Minister ofNational Service.Secretary.Sir Edward Bridges.The Budget. The Chancellor of the Exchequer communicated to the War(Previous Cabinet full particulars of his financial proposals for the forth-Keference: coming Budget.W.M. (40) 99th jn accoraance with precedent, the details are not recorded in conclusions, War Cabinet Conclusions.Minute 9.)Great George Street, S. W. 1,April 2, 1941.[22386]
